events.name: Android Developer Meetup
events.description:
This is the legendary first meetup. Be part of it. We will talk about Android in general and get to know other Android developers or people interested in Android in our region.

If you have any suggestions for the next meetups just join the Slack group and start participating. Just fill out the following form and I will authorize you: https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSdGKRA1K6NdvP9QKpKuJ1UB8rg1JD-3nFJdHJ6wBaud4YxqZA/viewform

events.name: Android Developer Meetup
events.description: Our monthly meetup. This time we will all together watch the livestream broadcasting the news about the latest google products. Looking forward to meeting you there.

events.name: Android Developer Meetup
events.description: This time we discuss ConstraintLayout and your experience with it as well as the new DataBinding lib of Android. Have you already used this feature? Feel free to prepare a lightning talk for this subject! Food and drinks are supplied by Adorsys GmbH! So come in.

events.name: Android Developer Meetup
events.description: Last time we talked about Data Binding and tonight will be about ConstraintLayout. Be prepared.

events.name: Android Developer Meetup
events.description: This is a relaxed new years meetup without any special subject. Only good pizza and beer. If you want to talk about something you are very welcome...

events.name: Android Developer Meetup
events.description:
Marco Kotz from AppWork will prepare a talk about RxJava and invites us to the office of his employer AppWork GmbH which is famous for its Software "JDownloader".

For more information join our Slack group. See you!

events.name: Android Developer Meetup
events.description:
This time we will be talking about Kotlin. And I'm not talking about the Russian island  and I won't either compare it to the Indonesian island Java, but talk about both as a language. I recently started learning Kotlin and my talk will introduce you to my first month with Kotlin, things I liked and things I really didn't understand. 

Hope to see you around:

By the way --> Pizza & Drinks for free
events.how_to_find_us: The posters will lead you to the right spot

events.name: Android Developer Meetup
events.description:
A little intermezzo from the last talk intensive meetups. Android O has been announced and we will talk about it and its new features. Like always, ee will exchange our experiences with Android, talk about projects, get Android help and probably get someone to give another talk while enjoying the nice Anderland pizza and having a little foosball match maybe.

If you feel like introducing the group to a subject of your choice you are welcome.

events.name: GDG & ADG-Special: Google I/O Extended
events.description:
Google I/O is an annual developer festival that takes place in Mountain View, California. The festival features experiential learning, Google’s latest developer products, and talks from Google Product Managers & Engineers — plus a few surprises along the way.

If your work is somehow related to Google products, you're probably thrilled and can't wait to see the keynote. You have marked the date in your calendar. But you can't make it to Mountain View to see it live.

No problem! Google is going to live stream the keynote and, in cooperation with the <a>Google Developer Group Erlangen Nürnberg</a>, we'll host a Google I/O Extended event. Join us and watch the keynote with your fellow Google-enthusiasts!

To make this event even more enjoyable, AppWork GmbH from Fürth makes sure we are not running out of beer and pizza!

The Google Developer Group Erlangen-Nürnberg also announced this event in their group. You would help us a lot if you RSVP just for one meetup if you're member of both meetup groups.

events.name: Android Developer Meetup
events.description: I/O Review & Evaluation. News you might have missed. Google and Android and the future...

events.name: Android Developer Meetup
events.description: Today's talk will be about Job Scheduler.

events.name: Android Developer Meetup
events.description:
Project Presentation: Wifi Direct

- Today Nino is presenting a project which implements Wifi Direct and gives a short introduction over the technical implementation. After that, as the project is not finished yet, there is plenty of time to talk about it, suggest optimizations and help.

events.name: Android Developer Meetup
events.description:
"Come check out a few new things made by Google". As the pixel 2 presentation and some other things are being streamed on 4th october our monthly meetup was moved by one day. We will watch the stream together, have some PIZZA and DRINKS. 

If we have time, we will proceed as planned with the hands on session about animations. Here is the original text: "This meetup will be about animations. In particular animations with ConstraintLayout but if you have other animation questions we can also try to help you. It will show you also how to use ConstraintLayout if you missed our meetup about the basics. Bring your laptop - this will be a hands on session!"
events.how_to_find_us: You find us in the 3rd floor - the door should be open. If not call me 015738813188

events.name: Android Developer Meetup
events.description: In this meetup we will learn all about animations with ConstraintLayout. Was schedules for last meetup but postponed as Google presented its new products. So come and bring your laptop, learn to be a pixel star...

events.name: Android Developer Meetup "Christkindlesmarkt special"
events.description: We will discuss our next steps as Android group and I will reveal some very special news to the community which will have influence on our future as group.
events.how_to_find_us: Meet us at the fountain, near the "fake" golden ring

events.name: Kotlin coroutines with Victor Kropp (JetBrains)
events.description:
Victor Kropp from JetBrains Munich will give a talk about his experience with Kotlin over the last years. He's been using Kotlin for several years now and can provide some deep insight into the language and its features. The main focus though is on Kotlin's suspendable functions also known as coroutines, which allow supporting async/await, yield and similar patterns.
Victor will show how to use coroutines in Kotlin and how they work under the hood. So come by and benefit. Don't miss this great opportunity.
Refreshing drinks of all kinds are available in the location for a small fee and pizza is sponsored by Adorsys GmbH & Co KG. Thanks!
events.how_to_find_us: Enter the coutyard and go around the building turn directly left and take the steps until you reach the 3rd floor. There will also be signs which lead you to the right spot.

events.name: Learn Android Things
events.description:
We could get some Android Things Developer Kits (ATDevKit) and want to share some basic knowledge on how to build great everyday-life devices with our Android knowledge.

We received great support from GDG Munich Android whose co-organizer Benjamin Stürmer will give an introductory talk to Android Things. So we also have good technical support for all you tinkerers out there!

More on the developer kits and the hardware Google will provide us with: https://developer.android.com/things/hardware/index.html

There will also be some afternoon pizza sponsored by AppWorks GmbH!

Come and join us for tinkering with the developer kits and have some fun.

14:00 : Introduction
14:15 : Introductory talk by Benjamin Stürmer from GDG Munich Android
14:45 : Barcamp / Collect ideas for projects & talks
15:00 - 20:00 : Starting to work on projects / attending talks

Please bring your own project ideas or share your own knowledge by having a talk if you want - we'll collect ideas and vote in the beginning of the meetup!

* Please remember to bring your laptop and check the following things *:
- up-to-date and running instance of Android Studio
- android sdk, platform-tools & tools in system path (needed for setup script)
events.how_to_find_us: Just follow the signs, they will lead you to the right location. In words: Enter the courtyard, go to the right and until the end - turn left and enter the staircase - go until you reach the last door.

events.name: Start with Android - A meetup for beginners
events.description:
This time we think about all the people who just want to start with Android development. Together we will build a first simple Android app and will be open for questions about anything you want to know about our little green fellow.

The event will consist of a talk about Android basics, which will roughly take 45 minutes and will be followed by a workshop. Consider it a mini-feature-packed-seminary. It's Android university for all of you out there. Come and join, become a successful Android developer today!

14:00 Coffee
14:30 Introductory Talk by Stefan Blos
15:15 Presentation Codelab
15:30 - 20:00 Coding && foosball

Please make sure to bring your laptop with the latest version of Android Studio
events.how_to_find_us: Just follow the Meetup signs - and take one of the elevators.

events.name: Exchanging Architectures - Discuss your private best practices
events.description:
This is meant as an interactive meetup about architecture. Interactive because you are all invited to come and share the app architecture you in your opinion consider the best or worst or which you simply want to discuss about to get some feedback.

Those who don't know much about mobile architecture are also invited to come and get inspired by the community's ideas...
events.how_to_find_us: Enter the courtyard, and go until you reach the end on the right, go around the corner and take the steps until the 3rd floor. There will definitely by signs as well!

events.name: Google I/O extended with GDG Erlangen
events.description:
VENUE:
Find us at E-Werk Erlangen, Fuchsenwiese 1, Clubbühne

EVENT:
Excited what Google will reveal this year on I/O? Let's check it out together. We will watch the keynote of Google I/O with the GDG Erlangen on a big screen with cinema feeling at Kellerbühne, E-Werk, Erlangen.

Google will provide swag for the event so make sure to grab some.

Check out https://events.google.com/io/ for more information about the I/O.

What's already clear from the shedule: There will be a lot of Kotlin and Flutter around this year!

Please RSVP for the GDG Erlangen's event to make it easier for us to keep an overview https://www.meetup.com/Google-Developer-Group-Erlangen-Nurnberg/events/249197828/

events.name: Google I/O Extended - Let's talk Flutter with Flutter GDE Pascal Welsch
events.description:
Flutter Google Developer Expert (GDE) Pascal Welsch will pay us a visit and introduce us in his talk to Flutter.

"Flutter is a open-source mobile application development SDK created by Google. It is used to develop applications for Android and iOS [...]" (Wikipedia)

On Google I/O Flutter was widely talked about.

What's new about Flutter? Why is it not just another cross plattform development tool? When does it make sense to use it? There are definitely a lot of questions which Pascal will be able to answer.

So come and join.

Agenda:
7 - 7:30 pm meet & talk (pizza)
7:30 - 8:15 pm talk by Flutter GDE Pascal Welsch
8:15 - 10 pm Flutter Codelab

events.name: Do ConstraintLayout with Android GDE Wolfram Rittmeyer
events.description:
At this year's IO Google presented many new and upcoming features we can expect from the layout editor in Android Studio and from ConstraintLayout.

In his talk, Wolfram Rittmeyer is presenting all the announced features and goes into what you can use right now and what is going to come with future releases. One of the biggest additions is to easily define ConstraintSets and switch between them easily. And you can not only switch between them, you can create nice animations between those ConstraintSets, entirely defined in XML.

Wolfram Rittmeyer is also going to mention some limitations of the current implementation.

And don't worry if you haven't used ConstraintLayout yet. A short overview of what you can do with 1.1 brings everyone up to speed and on a level playing field.

Parking lots for visitors are available in Muggenhofer Str. (Parken "auf AEG")

Agenda:

19:00 - 19:30 Pizza & get to know each other
19:30 - 20:30 Talk by Wolfram + questions
20:30 - 22:00 Drink & apply what we just learned for the eager ones

events.name: In vino veritas est - find out the truth about Android at Lederer Kulturbrauerei
events.description:
Hi Androids, after our little summer break we'll start slowly by just gathering and chatting. As always, there will be still some hot topics to talk about:

- What's up on October 4th?
- What's up from 11th - 12th November?
- Why is this glass not full and still foaming?
- What are your experiences with Android since we last met?
- What do you think should be OUR communities app about? (Because we want to built one - for the PlayStore).

Just come by and meet old friends or make new ones. We are THE Android community - the cool guys and we are going to make things happen!
events.how_to_find_us: We have a reservation - so if you don't find us, just ask the waiter

events.name: Let's Hack Firebase MLKit - Android Machine Learning Hackathon
events.description:
This is a hackathon for building your app with machine learning capabilities during the Digital Festival in Nuremberg. Therefore, please register for the event at: Please register for the event at https://events.nueww.de/tms/frontend/index.cfm?l=1813&sp_id=1.

Joe Birch explains it as follows: "At Google I/O this year we saw the introduction of Firebase MLKit, a part of the Firebase suite that intends to give our apps the ability to support intelligent features with more ease. The SDK currently comes with a collection of pre-defined capabilities that are commonly required in applications - you'll be able to implement these in your application regardless of whether you are familiar with machine learning or not."

The schedule will be as follows:
14:00 - Get to know each other / food
14:45 - Pitch your idea or join others
15:15 - Start working with ML Kit or Tensorflow.

We'll be around to support you or work with you on your idea. Hope to see you all.

events.name: DACHFest 2018 (DevFest DACH)
events.description:
For this year's DevFest season, GDG and WTM communities of Germany, Austria, and Switzerland are all working together to organize our largest event yet: DACHFest!

DACHFest is a two-day DevFest conference focused on making a difference. Meet technology experts, discover all the different ways in which emerging technology is transforming lives, find out how to make your apps and websites friendly towards everyone, learn the secrets of building and nurturing a diverse community — let our speakers surprise and inspire you! And don't forget to make new friends: there will be plenty of opportunities to meet people passionate about your favorite things. ❤️

Join us in Munich on November 10–11 for two days full of talks, workshops, showcases, networking, and fun!

DACHFest is a paid event, but diversity scholarships are available for people who belong to underrepresented groups in tech or cannot afford a ticket.

Website: https://dachfest.com
Twitter: https://twitter.com/dachfest
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/GDG.DACHFest

events.name: Let's watch "Flutter Live"
events.description:
Join us for Flutter Live on December 4th to experience the latest from Flutter, Google’s free and open source SDK for building high-quality native iOS and Android apps from a single codebase. Presented from the Science Museum in London.

We will stream this event and talk about the latest developments in Flutter development. For those who are interested we will also provide a first inside in flutter development.

Flutter is interesting because it's beside a development tool for iOS & Android also the primary SDK for developing Fuchsia apps, Google's new operating system running on all kinds of devices ("from embedded systems to smartphones, tablets and personal computers").

The location is inside the Babylon cinema Fürth. We also have enough tables to code later if some of you are interested.

What will be definitely around is free Pizza and we hope to get some Flutter SWAG for everyone.

More information about the live stream can be found here: https://developers.google.com/events/flutter-live/

events.name: Android Jetpack Explained
events.description: At Google I/O Jetpack was announced as a superset of libraries following Google's definition of Android best practices. One part of this are the old support libraries which have been repacked and redistributed as androidX (short form for Android Extensions). Some other libraries have joined. This meetup will give a more detailed overview of what Jetpack is, what it contains and how you use it / migrate from the old support libraries.

events.name: Solve your Android problems in a group
events.description:
We will as a group give everyone the opportunity to present a problem he/she is currently stuck with and solve it as a group with a technique called Mastermind.

- collect and define the problem
- give everyone some time to silently solve the problem
- give everyone the time to present his/her solution to the problem

This will hopefully solve the problem but even more: We will find out how others would have solved the issue and learn from their approaches.

Bring your laptop, if you can.

events.name: Hash Code Coding Competition
events.description:
What is Hash Code?

Google’s team-based programming competition, Hash Code, allows you to share your skills and connect with other coders as you work together to solve a problem modeled off a real Google engineering challenge! In small teams of two to four, coders all over the world will tackle the first problem through an Online Qualification Round. Though this round is hosted online, teams can come together to compete side-by-side in locally coordinated Hash Code hubs. The top teams from this round are invited to join us at an international Google office for our annual Hash Code Final Round.

How it works

Once you’ve registered for the contest, you’ll gain access to our Judge System. The Judge System is our online platform where you’ll form your team, join a hub, practice, and compete during the rounds. During the Online Qualification Round, you’ll watch our YouTube livestream to be introduced to the problem, and your team will have four hours to solve an optimization problem using the programming language and tools of your choice. Teams can compete from a local hub or another location of their choice. The top teams from the Online Qualification Round will be invited to the Final Round at a Google office, where they’ll work together to solve another challenge and compete for cash prizes.

If you's like to join our existing team, go to this link:
https://hashcodejudge.withgoogle.com/#join-team/[masked]/m_SRKX_Q6t87mkPPqDQdVvH3pbTZ8d0ouwciWXjor5E

You can always create a new team and join our Hub "GDG Nuremberg Android"

Pizza is sponsored by adorsys! See you around.

events.name: Kotlin - why, how, when - why?
events.description:
Java for Android Development is a valid approach but when looking into your crash reports you might also experience a good reason to switch to Kotlin: NullPointerExceptions.

In this meetup Nino will give you reasons to switch to Kotlin if you haven't done yet and explain why it is nothing to be afraid of.

The talk will consist of two parts. The first one introduces you to Kotlin and some features you might not know. The second part of the talk will be about interoperability between Kotlin and Java and how to call Kotlin code from Java.

We would be happy to see you around for this technical session. Bring your laptops if you like to try out things...
events.how_to_find_us:
Best reached by bike or public transport.
At the location: 
Go into the backyard and follow the signs until you reach a door to a stairwell. Go all the way up there.

events.name: Testing - how to test your mobile app
events.description:
This time there will be two talks about testing and we are super excited about both of them:

You might know our first confirmed speaker, Wolfram Rittmeyer, Android and Google Assistant GDE (Google Developer Expert), who will introduce the testing library "KotlinTest" which declares itself as "Powerful, elegant and flexible Kotlin test framework".

Wolfram is a real expert when it comes to coding:
- Nearly 20 years of Java experience
- 6 years of Android experience
- Google Developer Expert for Android since 2016
- Google Developer Expert for the Google Assistant since early 2018

We are sure that during this time he gathered a bit of testing experience and we are very proud to host him already the second time here in Nuremberg.

Secondly, Xaver Lohmüller, iOS developer at adorsys GmbH & Co KG will introduce us to testing techniques within the iOS framework and personal best practices. Xaver's personal nightmare is to become color blind as he enjoys his numerous tests to be green.

Xaver is known as one of the best presenters at adorsys so be prepared to have some fun during his talk!

Together, we will think about how we can transform the iOS tests to Android and as always the rest is unplanned and up to live coding, lightning talks, talking to each other and anything else fun.

Looking forward to seeing you!

answers.question: How are you related to Android?
What do you expect from this group?
How are you related to Android?
answers.answer: Developing Android apps for a better world

answers.question: What do you expect from this group?
answers.answer: Get to know more people who like this little green fellow / hear what's on your Android mind...
